intro: Fimbristylis tenuissima, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has a compact growth habit with short, upright stems. Fimbristylis tenuissima is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
